timeline.message:
[miio] add helper string

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

miio more readme text updates to cleanup formatting

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

miio add rounded number to avoid merging issues in the future

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

timeline.body:
Why format it as a floating point? Why not just use `%d` instead so it prints as an integer?
```suggestion
        String devicesCount = String.format("Currently the miio binding supports more than %d different models.",
                items;
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Why format it as a floating point? Why not just use %d instead so it prints as an integer?

Suggested change
String devicesCount = String.format("Currently the miio binding supports more than %.0f different models.",
Math.floor(items / 10) * 10);
String devicesCount = String.format("Currently the miio binding supports more than %d different models.",
items;
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I had that indeed but it gave me an error as it considered the outcome of the calc a double
replies.author: marcelrv

replies.bodyText:
Ah, I just realized that you are trying to round to the nearest 10. In that case, since items is a long, all you would need to do is (items/10)*10.
Math.floor returns a double.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I want it to round down to the lower  10. I guess that I could deduct 5 and keep it as long, but I think the floor function is cleaner
replies.author: marcelrv

replies.bodyText:
what you think is cleaner to round down to the nearest 10?
((items-5)/10)*10   and %d    or  Math.floor(items / 10) * 10); and %0.f  both would show the same. My idea was the latter but I can't be too bothered about it
replies.author: marcelrv

replies.bodyText: Dividing an integer by another integer will automatically floor the result. But if you are more comfortable with using Math.floor and %0.f then I'm not going to stop you.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: ah... got it... thought that way it was doing a regular round instead of a floor.
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.message:
[miio] improve from feedback

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>
